data.text:
Since before the ground offensive, Israel has designated the Al-Muwasi area as a humanitarian zone and urged Gazan civilians to evacuate there temporarily for their safety. We want civilians to be protected in areas where Hamas is not already using them as human shields. 

It is… https://t.co/yOx4bKOZJ9 https://t.co/aGO79XAkbE

note_tweet.text:
Since before the ground offensive, Israel has designated the Al-Muwasi area as a humanitarian zone and urged Gazan civilians to evacuate there temporarily for their safety. We want civilians to be protected in areas where Hamas is not already using them as human shields. 

It is horrific that UN agencies have endangered them by funneling them into Hamas strongholds instead of facilitating their safe evacuation to the humanitarian zone. And it is horrific that UN agencies cannot bring themselves to condemn Hamas for shooting rockets at Israeli communities from out of the humanitarian zone. 

Civilians must be protected from Hamas. 

Ironically, the only people encouraging the mass displacement of Gazans are those who falsely label most of them “refugees” and indulge their dreams of relocating into Israel through violent struggle, instead of living in peace alongside us.

data.text: Roth & by extension HRW is exposed: there is no benchmark no standard or comparison to assess if attack is disproportionate. Roth does not know details of Jebaliya attack, claims "judgement" in total vacuum. The true standard he & HRW use: if Israel bombs it's a war crime. END

When Dworman presses on this, Roth mockingly says that when Israel talks about civilian deaths they say “human shields human shields, that’s their answer” and even if that’s the case the attack has to be proportionate – but Roth again offers no guidelines on this when asked. 13/

Roth downplays Hamas use of human shields & firing from civilian areas. Dworman plays recording where Roth can only say “I assume that [human shields] is true at times.” In fact Hamas’ core strategy is using civilians to counter IDF. HRW always gives Hamas free pass on this. 12/

entity.name: Global security & terrorism
entity.description: Global conversation about threats of terrorism, response of governments, and national security

data.text: Dworman asks when would an Israeli bombing be legitimate. Roth answers Israel can bomb a “Hamas command center sitting in the middle of a field.” Dworman points out “that doesn’t exist” but Roth effectively tells the IDF they can’t bomb any Hamas site if civilians present. 11/

entity.name: Global security & terrorism
entity.description: Global conversation about threats of terrorism, response of governments, and national security

data.text: Roth still won’t answer says “you use the means that are most precise least likely to harm civilians.” Roth then arrogantly asserts IDF should “go in with personnel” which of course would warn Hamas commander & fighters who would of course clear tunnel well in advance. 10/

entity.name: Global security & terrorism
entity.description: Global conversation about threats of terrorism, response of governments, and national security

data.text: Roth does not answer, so Dworman again asks acting as Israeli PM: “I do want to bomb this command center…how do I measure proportionality if the guy in charge of calling it disproportionate after being asked five times won’t even give a range of civilians?” [Great question!] 9/

Dworman presses Roth: “how many would be a close call?” Roth changes the subject. Dworman asks again “I’m the PM of Israel & have the HRW head in my office… [I ask] what number would be OK…you say it’s a judgement call... so give me something to go on, how many civilians?” 8/

Dworman than asks the KEY question: “How many civilian lives would you say is proportionate to a Central Command Center and a major planning leader?” Roth: “There’s not a concrete answer to that these are judgement calls, HRW does not condemn if it’s close call.” 7/

Roth’s core premise on Jebaliya was that US would never drop 2,000lb or even 1000lb bomb in populated area. This is Roth's only provided evidence why he claims war crime. Dworman then shows several examples when US did, like this report from 2021 in NY Times, so Roth lies. 6/ https://t.co/jOUrHXDM0n

data.text: IDF soldiers in Gaza have expressed frustration that the ground campaign is painstakingly slow.  I asked why that is so.  They said, for example, when they call in an air strike against a terrorist target, it takes forever to get clearance.  Why?  Because the IDF insists on… https://t.co/m0SNt4xKK1

note_tweet.text:
IDF soldiers in Gaza have expressed frustration that the ground campaign is painstakingly slow.  I asked why that is so.  They said, for example, when they call in an air strike against a terrorist target, it takes forever to get clearance.  Why?  Because the IDF insists on making sure there are no innocent civilians around.  Did the US do this in World War 2?  Korea?  Vietnam? Iraq? Afghanistan? Of course not.  But Israel does and it puts our soldiers at risk.  But you know what?  The soldiers I spoke with said they wouldn’t have it any other way.

So remember this when you read the Palestinian propaganda about Israel slaughtering innocents in Gaza.  War is hell and innocents will be hurt, but Israel is doing the best it can to avoid needless carnage while at the same time ridding the world of bestial terror.

“There is no place for Hamas in the post-Gaza war calculations. Hamas committed crimes also against its ‘people’ - the defenseless Palestinian civilians. The Hamas attacks have returned the Palestinian… https://t.co/UDDE2jDC5v https://t.co/8tr7Nh52Fi

note_tweet.text:
Dr. Salem Alketbi, an Emirati political analyst and strategic expert, writes:

“There is no place for Hamas in the post-Gaza war calculations. Hamas committed crimes also against its ‘people’ - the defenseless Palestinian civilians. The Hamas attacks have returned the Palestinian cause to square one.

There is no doubt that what Hamas caused is a strategic catastrophe in every sense of the word for the Palestinian cause and people. Hamas has lost all the gains it has achieved on the ground since its founding.

Hamas remains just an organization that will not bear responsibility for what happened, because it did not bear responsibility for the Palestinian cause and the Palestinian people before the October 7 attack, otherwise it would have carefully studied the repercussions of the attack”.

Al-Arab newspaper

note_tweet.text:
Sickening - the newly formed “Doctors Against Genocide” plans to infiltrate the U.S. Holocaust Museum this Thursday (12/28) to demand Israel stop defending itself against Hamas terrorism.

Who exactly is this group? 
👉🏼 According to Roll Call, one of the founding members of DAG is Nidal Jboor a physician from Dearborn, MI. 
👉🏼 Nidal Jboor is seen here speaking next to antisemites Rashida Tlaib and Cori Bush, at an organized press conference from 12/7, demanding Israel stop attacking Hamas.
👉🏼 They were formed last month and focus solely on Israel 
👉🏼 According to its website, DAG is a program of "Jetpac," a 501c3 who “seeks to build a strong American Muslim political infrastructure and increase our community’s influence”

Hamas has one goal - to murder Jews. For this physicians’ group to desecrate the Holocaust museum with their calls of a ceasefire (ie - for the Jewish nation to stop defending itself) is stomach churning.

note_tweet.text:
I wonder how many of those reading this essay note that, as this Hamas-appointed mayor writes, Gaza had a "cultural center, a theater, a public library, a beautiful seafront, a zoo, a Children's Happiness Center, recreation spaces, small cafes and parks." 

The mayor traveled abroad. His son was a "photojournalist and filmmaker." 

He is angry about Israel's "occupation," neglecting to note that Israelis withdrew from Gaza in 2005. 

He asks: "Why can’t Palestinians be treated equally, like Israelis and all other peoples in the world? Why can’t we live in peace and have open borders and free trade?"

He doesn't mention the massacre, mass rapes, and kidnapping of children that were carried out by Hamas on Oct. 10.  He doesn't mention that Hamas still holds hostages and continues to kill Israelis.

His editors at the NYT apparently thought none of that relevant.

tweets.text: Roth does not answer, so Dworman again asks acting as Israeli PM: “I do want to bomb this command center…how do I measure proportionality if the guy in charge of calling it disproportionate after being asked five times won’t even give a range of civilians?” [Great question!] 9/

tweets.text: Of course, there were no Christians or Muslims at that time, and the Arabs were still concentrated in the Arabian Peninsula - they only arrived in the region about 700 years later.

For those less familiar: When Jesus was born, between one million and one and a half million people lived in the land of Israel - the overwhelming majority of them were Jews, and the minorities included Pagans, Samaritans, as well as Hellenistic Greeks, and Romans.

The Palestinians need to decide.

Either they are currently executing in broad daylight one of the greatest identity thefts in human history, as their propaganda attempts to turn Jesus into a Palestinian,

or they genuinely believe this, implicitly acknowledging that Palestine… https://t.co/fAn9Vf8UJ5 https://t.co/tNgVCoWqxJ

🚨#BREAKING: NYPD Calls for Level Three Mobilization Amidst Numerous Fights Between Pro-Palestine Protesters and Police at a Large Protest

📌#Manhattan l #NewYork

Currently, the New York Police Department has requested a Level Three mobilization for a large protest that is taking place in Midtown Manhattan, where Pro-Palestine protesters are reportedly engaging in fights with the police. Numerous altercations have broken out between the two resulting in reported injuries to multiple officers. The extent of the injuries is currently unknown at this time. Police have also Reportedly made multiple arrests

tweets.text:
John Spencer, world's leading expert on urban warfare:
 “There have been false statements, like the use of the term ‘most destructive war of the modern era,’ when it compares maybe a battle against one city in combination to all the cities in Gaza.

There’s no military in the… https://t.co/6Yd9H2KVGo https://t.co/UpylI9Gi5S

note_tweet.text:
John Spencer, world's leading expert on urban warfare:
 “There have been false statements, like the use of the term ‘most destructive war of the modern era,’ when it compares maybe a battle against one city in combination to all the cities in Gaza.

There’s no military in the world that has faced the challenge Israel is facing right now in the war against Hamas. 

An entire underground war, where the enemy is using the civilian population as its strategy — to try to get the other side to stop moving forward, for their military strategic objective.

No military has faced a military that is shooting at civilians behind them, in the midst of the operation. Because, of the 13,000 Hamas rockets, 100% of those have been dumb: they do not have precision-guided munition. Nobody’s talking about that statistic.”

Maj. (ret) John Spencer is Chair of Urban Warfare Studies at the Modern War Institute at West Point. He was an advisor to U.S. military leaders, and served over 25  years in the active army including as a company commander in Iraq. He is the author of the book Understanding Urban Warfare. @SpencerGuard
